tasks.title: Measure 3 â€“ Assess the scope of the incident
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

Assess the scope of the incident

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

* Investigate potential administrative access hijacking

  * Was an authentication using an admin account performed illegitimately on the management interface shortly before the defacement?

    * If yes:

      * Do the logs confirm the illicit modification by this account that caused the defacement?
      * Was it an internal company account or a service provider account?
* Assess potential compromise of web servers

  * Antivirus or EDR alerts on the host server
  * Alerts on security devices upstream of the website (WAF, firewall, proxy)
  * Presence of known vulnerabilities?
  * Authentication with an admin account on the host server shortly before the defacement?
* Assess potential spread of the compromise

  * Is the website hosted by the organization?
  * Was an administrative account identified as hijacked?
* Assess potential compromise of the cloud tenant

tasks.title: Measure 5 â€“ Assess the urgency to resolve the incident
tasks.description:
## ğŸ¯ Objective

Assess the urgency of response based on impacted vital activities, availability of nominal/degraded modes (BCP/DRP), and risk of escalation.

---

### ğŸ“Œ Actions:

For each vital activity impacted previously identified:

* Is there a business continuity procedure in nominal mode?
* Is there a degraded mode business continuity procedure?

  * If yes:

    * Are these procedures already being implemented?
    * How long can they be sustained?
* Have any restoration actions already been undertaken?

The goal of the above actions is to answer the following evaluation needs:

* Which vital activities are disrupted, requiring preventive business continuity measures?
* Is there a risk that the incident will imminently escalate?

---

### âœ… Deliverables

* Summary of urgency level (low / moderate / high / critical) with justification.
* Comments added to the **TheHive** incident (findings, decisions, deadlines).
* Attachments/observables: BCP/DRP exports, restoration tracking captures, change logs.
